blog.name: gryffinoir
blog.title: Be A Dragon
blog.description:
E L I Z A B E T H // Gryffinclaw // House Stark

  Reincarnation of a beheaded Queen.

question: what about arya?
answer:
LOVE HER!

Though I do see more Sansa hate, so I tend to be more defensive of Sansa than Arya. Generally, Arya is a more popular character. 

I’m literally the biggest House Stark stan. I love them all. Sansa, Arya, Jon, and Robb are my faves though if I have to narrow it down.

summary: Continuing the stark theme....Arya and Jon?
question: Continuing the stark theme....Arya and Jon?
answer:
Arya:

general opinion: fall in a hole and die | don’t like them | eh | they’re fine I guess | like them! | love them | actual love of my life
hotness level: get away from me | meh | neutral (she’s a kid) | theoretically hot but not my type | pretty hot | gorgeous! | 10/10 would bang
hogwarts house: gryffindor | slytherin | ravenclaw | hufflepuff
best quality: Brave. She’s a survivor. She’s smart
worst quality: Jumps to conclusions quickly. Has a temper. Has a black and white mentality
ship them with: No one
brotp them with: Hot Pie. Gendry
needs to stay away from: Grown men. War. Witnessing the death of her parents. Cults.
misc. thoughts: I wish we got a better description of the play in the Mercy chapter

Jon:

general opinion: fall in a hole and die | don’t like them | eh | they’re fine I guess | like them! | love them | actual love of my life
hotness level: get away from me | meh | neutral | theoretically hot but not my type | pretty hot | gorgeous! | 10/10 would bang
hogwarts house: gryffindor | slytherin | ravenclaw | hufflepuff
best quality: He fight good. Honorable. 
worst quality: Bad leader. Isolates himself from his men. 
ship them with: No one
brotp them with: Sam. Grenn. Pyp
needs to stay away from: Angry employees
misc. thoughts: I hope against all evidence that he stays dead because his place in the narrative can be filled by other characters easily

summary: And afterward, they insisted she dress herself in girl's things, brown woolen stockings and a light linen shift, and over that a...
body:
And afterward, they insisted she dress herself in girl’s things, brown woolen stockings and a light linen shift, and over that a light green gown with acorns embroidered all over the bodice in brown thread, and more acorns bordering the hem. […] “In times like these, we all must make do as best we can.” Lady Smallwood fussed at the bodice of the gown. “Now you look a proper young lady.”
I’m not a lady, Arya wanted to tell her, I’m a wolf.

So the next morning as they broke their fast, Lady Smallwood gave her breeches, belt, and tunic to wear, and a brown doeskin jerkin dotted with iron studs. “They were my son’s things,” she said. “He died when he was seven.”
“I’m sorry, my lady.” Arya suddenly felt bad for her, and ashamed. “I’m sorry I tore the acorn dress too. It was pretty.”
“Yes, child. And so are you. Be brave.”

- a Storm of Swords

summary: God, I just remembered that we’re gonna get a Jon and Arya reunion finally. Like...I’ve been waiting for this since season one....
body: God, I just remembered that we’re gonna get a Jon and Arya reunion finally. Like…I’ve been waiting for this since season one. I love their sibling dynamic so much. Like…please D&D. Please don’t fuck it up. Give me happiness before you crush me.

title: Dirty Paws
description:
by KingInDaNorf98

Jon’s feelings for Arya fester after Daenerys betrays his men in a fit of madness. The Long Night is over, but the war is not won. Not on the battlefield, and not on the heart.
“Jon’s eyes along with his sense of smell were far superior to most, and that sight that greeted him was one he would never forget. Here was Arya in all her feminine glory, shirt bunched up around her armpits and her black breeches pooled around her ankles. Her hair was a sleek curtain of midnight black against her pillow as she arched and writhed, her eyes squeezed shut and her mouth parted in a soundless gasp.”

Words: 5414, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Major Character Death, Underage
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark, Jaime Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, Davos Seaworth, Cersei Lannister, Gregor Clegane, Euron Greyjoy, Yara Greyjoy, Theon Greyjoy
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark

blog.name: princessmissandei
blog.title: Night Wolf
blog.description: Marie | Slytherin | Writer About and Before You Follow Multi-fandom blog with an emphasis on ASOIAF and various period dramas. Very fond of canon Starks, Targaryens, Durrandons and Baratheons. Reylos do not engage.

summary: Daenerys and Arya Could Have Survived what Sansa Survived
body:
Daenerys and Arya Could Have Survived what Sansa Survived

This is something that shouldn’t even be up for debate, but the misogynistic tendency to put other women down in order to prop another up has apparently made this a necessity. I’ll start by saying that all three characters go through hell and none of them deserve what they endure. They’re all strong. They’re all fascinating characters. It’s possible to praise any or all of them without hating on any other characters. 

Its also important to note that asserting that Arya and Dany could have survived what Sansa went through is not a slight on Sansa. But claiming that they couldn’t is a slight on both of them and requires dismissing both the complexity of their characters and the abuse they survive. And for the record, I don’t see why Sansa wouldn’t survive their situations either. Swapping the characters would simply result in changing the course of the story since the’re all unique.

I feel like I’m going to prove something akin to water being wet, but here we are. 

Really though, there is no reason why Dany or Arya couldn’t have survived captivity in King’s Landing. They have both survived very similar situations under more strenuous circumstances. 

With Dany, as @jonerya pointed out, she spends years growing up with the Targaryen version of Joffrey, Viserys. He beats Dany repeatedly and molests her. She spends her childhood and her adolesence living in constant fear, conforming her behavior to avoid abuse, much the way Sansa has to guard her tongue and make herself appear submissive. Both of them slip up from time to time and are still beaten even when they haven’t “slipped”. It’s worth noting that Dany is on her own with Viserys. There’s no one there to step in and remind him that she’s valuable. It isn’t until she gets to the Dothraki that she is protected from him.

Dany and Sansa are both also sold into abusive situations. Viserys sells Dany as a sex slave/child bride to Drogo while Dontos sells Sansa to Littlefinger, who molests her and keeps her with him by framing her for murder. Initially, before assimilating into the Dothraki culture as a coping mechanism, Dany is raped repeatedly until she contemplates suicide. But she manages to find the inner strength to endure and begins to thrive. 

Having gone through that as well as the struggles she continued to have, Dany could have survived as a captive of the Lannisters. 

With Arya, we already witnessed her surviving as a captive of the Lannisters. Like Sansa, Arya endures beatings from grown men and being held prisoner by people who are fighting and trying to kill her family. Both of them have to conform their behavior and guard their tongues. It’s very significant that Arya doesn’t have the protection of being a highborn hostage. If anyone decided to kill her, there would be no reprocussions. Most wouldn’t even know about it since she’s no more valuable than any other slave. So her situation was more precarious since she’s enduring the same thing, but without the shield of nobility.

So we know that Arya would have survived as a highborn prisoner of the Lannisters since we witnessed her surviving as a supposedly lowborn prisoner.

With Dany, as @jonerya pointed out, she spends years growing up with the Targaryen version of Joffrey, Viserys. He beats Dany repeatedly and molests her. She spends her childhood and her adolesence living in constant fear, conforming her behavior to avoid abuse, much the way Sansa has to guard her tongue and make herself appear submissive. Both of them slip up from time to time and are still beaten even when they haven’t “slipped”. It’s worth noting that Dany is on her own with Viserys. There’s no one there to step in and remind him that she’s valuable. It isn’t until she gets to the Dothraki that she is protected from him.

Dany and Sansa are both also sold into abusive situations. Viserys sells Dany as a sex slave/child bride to Drogo while Dontos sells Sansa to Littlefinger, who molests her and keeps her with him by framing her for murder. Initially, before assimilating into the Dothraki culture as a coping mechanism, Dany is raped repeatedly until she contemplates suicide. But she manages to find the inner strength to endure and begins to thrive. 

Having gone through that as well as the struggles she continued to have, Dany could have survived as a captive of the Lannisters. 

With Arya, we already witnessed her surviving as a captive of the Lannisters. Like Sansa, Arya endures beatings from grown men and being held prisoner by people who are fighting and trying to kill her family. Both of them have to conform their behavior and guard their tongues. It’s very significant that Arya doesn’t have the protection of being a highborn hostage. If anyone decided to kill her, there would be no reprocussions. Most wouldn’t even know about it since she’s no more valuable than any other slave. So her situation was more precarious since she’s enduring the same thing, but without the shield of nobility.

So we know that Arya would have survived as a highborn prisoner of the Lannisters since we witnessed her surviving as a supposedly lowborn prisoner.

trail.content_raw:
Daenerys and Arya Could Have Survived what Sansa Survived

This is something that shouldn’t even be up for debate, but the misogynistic tendency to put other women down in order to prop another up has apparently made this a necessity. I’ll start by saying that all three characters go through hell and none of them deserve what they endure. They’re all strong. They’re all fascinating characters. It’s possible to praise any or all of them without hating on any other characters. 

Its also important to note that asserting that Arya and Dany could have survived what Sansa went through is not a slight on Sansa. But claiming that they couldn’t is a slight on both of them and requires dismissing both the complexity of their characters and the abuse they survive. And for the record, I don’t see why Sansa wouldn’t survive their situations either. Swapping the characters would simply result in changing the course of the story since the’re all unique.

I feel like I’m going to prove something akin to water being wet, but here we are. 

Really though, there is no reason why Dany or Arya couldn’t have survived captivity in King’s Landing. They have both survived very similar situations under more strenuous circumstances. 

With Dany, as @jonerya pointed out, she spends years growing up with the Targaryen version of Joffrey, Viserys. He beats Dany repeatedly and molests her. She spends her childhood and her adolesence living in constant fear, conforming her behavior to avoid abuse, much the way Sansa has to guard her tongue and make herself appear submissive. Both of them slip up from time to time and are still beaten even when they haven’t “slipped”. It’s worth noting that Dany is on her own with Viserys. There’s no one there to step in and remind him that she’s valuable. It isn’t until she gets to the Dothraki that she is protected from him.

Dany and Sansa are both also sold into abusive situations. Viserys sells Dany as a sex slave/child bride to Drogo while Dontos sells Sansa to Littlefinger, who molests her and keeps her with him by framing her for murder. Initially, before assimilating into the Dothraki culture as a coping mechanism, Dany is raped repeatedly until she contemplates suicide. But she manages to find the inner strength to endure and begins to thrive. 

Having gone through that as well as the struggles she continued to have, Dany could have survived as a captive of the Lannisters. 

With Arya, we already witnessed her surviving as a captive of the Lannisters. Like Sansa, Arya endures beatings from grown men and being held prisoner by people who are fighting and trying to kill her family. Both of them have to conform their behavior and guard their tongues. It’s very significant that Arya doesn’t have the protection of being a highborn hostage. If anyone decided to kill her, there would be no reprocussions. Most wouldn’t even know about it since she’s no more valuable than any other slave. So her situation was more precarious since she’s enduring the same thing, but without the shield of nobility.

So we know that Arya would have survived as a highborn prisoner of the Lannisters since we witnessed her surviving as a supposedly lowborn prisoner.

blog.name: makerkenzie
blog.title: Meet the Maker
blog.description: Behold, the righteous altar to my ego. If you appreciate my sass, Buy Me a Coffee. If not, I assume you will read someone else's blog.

summary: A Critique of the Daughters and Bannermen Theory
body:
A Critique of the Daughters and Bannermen Theory

Unless someone else has a better name for the theory: the idea is that the contrast between Ned’s legacy and Tywin’s legacy is evident in the difference between their bannermen’s responses to their daughters being in trouble. Whereas the Northmen rally to war to rescue “Arya” (really Jeyne Poole, but the point is they think they’re rescuing Arya Stark) from the Boltons just because she’s Ned’s daughter, the Western lords don’t lift a finger to help Cersei when she’s in trouble with the Faith. Ned was an excellent leader because his vassals are willing to fight for his little girl, whereas Tywin was a shitbag because his vassals don’t give a damn about his daughter.


So here’s my issue with the contrast:


The differences between not-Arya’s victimization and Cersei’s arrest are so vast, they make a tenuous contrast at best.


I’m not defending Tywin; of course he was a monster. The problem is that Cersei is a monster in her own right, and her lack of allies following her arrest may have very little to do with how other Western lords feel about her father and much more to do with how she has no one to blame but herself for being on trial.


Arya (both the real one and the impostor) is a little girl who had no say in the sequence of events that put her in harm’s way. Arya is an innocent. Both real and impostor, Arya is a victim of grown-ass adults’ decisions.


Cersei is a grown woman in a position of immense power who landed in a trap of her own making. She dragged herself down into the muck and she took some much better people with her. Cersei is neither reasonable nor competent. Cersei does not have allies, she has a few sycophants and a lot more enemies. Cersei is toxic to the realm and disappointing, at best, to those who try to help her. Cersei is most valuable as a useful idiot to some other bad actor.


If Tywin had an 11-year-old daughter who was taken captive and abused by an enemy faction, then we’d like to see how his bannermen respond. If Ned had an adult daughter who put herself in hot water the way Cersei did, then we’d like to see what his vassals are prepared to put on the line to rescue Ned’s daughter.


Now, Cersei’s predicament, in itself, can be read in terms of Tywin’s legacy. That she was able to do what she did, had a lot to do with Tywin’s power plays. That she thought any of this shit was a good idea had a lot to do with how Tywin failed to engage with her. Sure, there are plenty of ways Tywin set the stage for Cersei to fuck everything up.


The silence of his bannermen in response to Cersei’s arrest, though? That’s not Tywin’s legacy. That’s Cersei’s legacy.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: there are really only two options for Widow’s Wail and Oathkeeper once the war for the dawn is over: have gendry reforge them to...
body: there are really only two options for Widow’s Wail and Oathkeeper once the war for the dawn is over: have gendry reforge them to remake Ice, or have a Braavosi blade forged out of one of them, preferably Widow’s Wail, for Arya to use

tags: i cant wait for them to lie and say they dont do this only for their blogs to be full of it
summary: In light of the latest wank, I have a genuine question for Sansa stans: why do so many of you heavily rely on hatred toward...
body:
In light of the latest wank, I have a genuine question for Sansa stans: why do so many of you heavily rely on hatred toward other female characters in order to defend or prop up Sansa? Why can’t she be discussed with her own merits rather than with negativity toward other women?

This has literally been going on for YEARS. For the longest time, Arya has been the main target for this fandom with post dedicated to hating multiple women at once with some of the most disgusting misogyny I’ve ever seen speckled here and there. Now, Dany is sharing the Sansa Stans Most Hated Character spot alongside Arya. I understand that men have pit women against each other for millennia by creating a societal structure where only some can appear to succeed at the expense of others, which has resulted in women almost instinctively targeting each other even when it doesn’t make any sense to do so. But we are moving into the year 2019. No one should so backward that they’re still relying on those archaic practices.

So … why? Why are you Sansa stans like this?

blog.description:
'Game of Thrones & a Parting Glass' lives here, don't ask why, but you can search by character or author if you wish. and sometimes i snap photos, write words, and paint pictures. and sometimes i realize it's all futile. <!-- Start of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->

i am not pitting them against each other
